Detailed Description

RamData provides a BinData interface to a dynamically allocated or statically defined RAM memory area. RamData can work on shuge buffers (restriction applies only to C166 architecture).

RamData * RamData::CreateInstance (  void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  length,
DrmLocalId  id = c_drm_invalid_local_id
)  [static]
 

Creates and returns an object of this class. Note that RamData will not delete the buffer on object destruction.

void* RamData::GetBuffer (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns a pointer to the passed buffer. It is recommended to use the Read methods for reading the buffer to comply with the generic BinData interface.
